channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Motorbike Abandoned, 17th October
item.description:
Police have come across an abandoned bike, with no VRM, it has been hotwired so clearly stolen. Can this be recovered as police unable to recover
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Georges Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Area across road, 17th October
item.description:
Area across the road at the beginning of old farm avenue. No doubt you will say it doesn't meet the criteria as you do for most reported potholes etc and just wait until it gets so bad it becomes more expensive to fix

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London

item.title: Paint dumped, 17th October
item.description:
There is wet paint all over the floor in and around the bus shelter. It looks like someone has dumped an entire can of paint out on the floor it is going everywhere and getting one peoples shoes and being tracked everywhere.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Newington Causeway, Elephant and Castle, London

item.title: Vehicle outside metas estate had been parked h the ere for 5 months, 17th October
item.description:

item.title: Items dumped, 17th October
item.description:
Someone has dumped a plastic bin filled with oars at the side of 77 Ridley Road, BR2. It keeps being knocked over and strewn over the pavement. Please can this be removed, thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ridley Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: On the bus shelter in Lennard Rd, Penge, southbound, about 10m SE of the jct with Newlands Park - two spray tags, black and red, on the single large square glass pane - looks like paint not acid., 17th October
item.description:
On the bus shelter in Lennard Rd, Penge, southbound, about 10m SE of the jct with Newlands Park - two spray tags, black and red, on the single large square glass pane - looks like paint not acid. Seen Friday 17/10/25.

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Illegal camping, 17th October
item.description:
Camp has been set up on mabley Green for at least a week. Small but aggressive dogs are being tied outside and owner is failing to control them. Was verbally abused while passing by after asking owner to call off dogs.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lee Conservancy Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
